member_organisations: ABB, AFME, Bosch, Caterpillar, CECE - European Construction Equipment Industry, CECIMO -  European Association of the Machine Tool Industries, CEMA - European Agricultural Machinery, Covestro, Dow, European Domestic Equipment Manufacturers, EEF - The Manufacturers' Organisation, General Electric, Hitachi, Orgalime -  European Engineering Industries Association, Schneider Electric, Siemens, United Technologies, Volvo, ZVEI - German Electrical and Electronic Association
fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Budget, Trade, Competition, Culture, International co-operation and development, Customs, Education and training, Enlargement, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Taxation, Youth, Single market, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Trans-European Networks, Food Safety, Digital economy and society, Transport, Climate Action, Communication, Banking and financial services
head_office_address: European Forum for Manufacturing Secretariat Rue de la Science 14B
eu_initiatives: Main EU policies currently followed include the €315bn Investment Plan; Digitising Industry; Trade and Investment Partnerships; Industry 4.0; Energy Efficiency; Ecodesign; Cybersecurity; FP 9; Compliance; Advanced Manufacturing; Sustainable Finance; Occupational Retirement Provision; Research & Innovation; Remanufacturing and the Circular Economy & Waste.
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
goals__remit: The EFM aims to contribute to the development of  European public  policies addressing the economic, employment, energy and environmental challenges facing technology and manufacturing globally.
